result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert J Powell IV was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay $400 for Buy Money to West Central MEG Unit

Restitution will be paid under the terms of a payment plan to be established with the PO but calling for no less than 2.5% of gross wages to be paid toward restitution and to be enforced through a wage assignment
.

Upon successful completion of all terms and conditions of probation, the record will be expunged under 973.015.
.

Complete any other assessments or counseling PO deems necessary

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Pay DOC Supervision fees

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

timeConds.notes:
To be served on Electronic Monitoring through Justice Support Services
.

supervisions.notes:
The balance of the sentence can be served on House Arrest through GPS monitoring.  The defendant can be let out for legitimate purposes only.  Def can start GPS on 7-28-17

Unpaid Court financial obligations are converted to a Civil Judgment
.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert J Powell IV

defendant.name: Powell, Robert J, IV
defendant.address: 5903 Robil Ct E, La Crosse, WI 54601

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
State by Strittmater /  Def in person w/ Atty Keith Belzer
PER CRT:  Def to start House Arrest on 7-30-17
from PO Ellefson   re: Sentencing After Revocation

Def in court w/Atty Keith Allen Belzer.  Susan C Donskey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DONSKEY: agreeing w/ the recommendation. He was found in a car w/ 29gm of THC and a lot of money - $8k.  He was on probation f/ possession w/ intent. To say that's from haircutting is disturbing. He hasn't learned anything from probation. Despite being unemployed he always had money. We would ask that it be served in custody given the nature of the conviction and he continued on with the same behavire. BELZER: we deny possession w/ intent. He found out he was offered a contract w/ the AM Basketball at that time. The amt in the bag is the amt if you were going to buy a large amt for personal use is consistent. No scales or baggies. He had the money b/c he was going to break up w his GF. It was from financial aid and from doing odd jobs. DOC won't take a position on EM or not. 135 days credit.  DEF: I am sorry and shouldn't be smoking pot but I was excited about the news I had. CRT: Many teams are more concerned w/ the image they project and want players that are clean. Why put at risk the opportunities by taking risky chances.And now you come in here and ask the court to fashion a sentence that excuses that so you can go on w/ your life despite crim activity that's at odds w/ the image teams want presented to the public. 
SENTENCE:   def to serve 9 mos CJ w/ credit for 135 days - balance can be served on house arrest thru GPS monitoring and can be let out for legit purposes - Def to start GPS on 7/28. Unpaid crt obligations converted to a civil judgment
ejss

ADDRESS INFO for Robert J Powell IV

Prior: 610 Mississippi Street, La Crosse, WI 54601

State by Hynek / Def w/ Atty Tim Guth
Amended Info filed
Stmt of Neg Plea / Plea Quest & Waiver filed
Ineligible Voting Notice filed
Def plead in 15CF506 / This Case Dismissed & read-in
Def:  I had THC on me but don't believe they can prove I intended to sell...
Guth: I believe it is provable by State & they have person in car who said my client was going to sell it
CRT:  will give def time to talk w/ his Atty
BACK ON RECORD - SAME APPEARANCES
Guth:  Def wants to now change his plea  to charge in 15CF467 - he has seen video in that & accepts facts in that case
CRT:  PLEA IN 15CF506 IS VACATED
Def pleads GUILTY in 15CF467
CRT finds def's plea is F & V made - sufficient factual basis exists to accept plea & finds def guilty
CRT'S SENTENCE:  Sent w/held;  Probation 3 yrs w/ conditions:  90 days CJ to be served on EM w/ JSS, w/ credit for 1 day;  Pay $400 for Buy Money to West Centeral MEG;  Complete any other assessments or counseling PO deems necessary;  Pay CC & DOC fees;  Upon successful completion of probation, then 973.015

9:45 AM - (w/ 15CF506) No appearance by Def - Atty Timothy J Guth present.  Justine L. Suleski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
bench warrant - $2500.00 cash bond - hold til end of day on Friday - covers both files

11:00 am -  Def in court w/Atty Timothy J Guth.  Emily Hynek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    
Prelim waiver filed - signed/understands.  No promises/threats.
COURT finds Waiver F V& I made -  Probable cause found - Bound over for trial.
Information filed - Reading waived.  Def Stands Mute - NG Pleas entered.

STC:  10/15/15 @ 10am (SLH)
